author: cbs8
title: Sellers Dorsey Announces the Sponsorship of the 2015 HCBS Conference
text:
Sellers Dorsey is pleased to announce its sponsorship of the 2015 National Home and Community Based Services (HCBS) Conference being held August 31 through September 3 in Washington, DC. The annual event, hosted by the National Association of States United for Aging and Disabilities, highlights state achievements in providing long term services and supports in a home and community based setting while facing the challenges including reduced budgets and growing populations.
Philadelphia, Pa (PRWEB) August 29, 2015
Sellers Dorsey is pleased to announce its sponsorship of the 2015 National Home and Community Based Services (HCBS) Conference being held August 31 through September 3 in Washington, DC. The annual event, hosted by the National Association of States United for Aging and Disabilities, highlights state achievements in providing long term services and supports in a home and community based setting while facing the challenges including reduced budgets and growing populations. The event provides an opportunity for local, state, and federal policymakers and key stakeholders to cultivate unique partnerships, share best practices and recognize the work of their peers.
Sellers Dorsey Senior Consultant Pam Coleman will be sharing her perspective at the conference. The presentation, Everything You Wanted to Know about Managed Long Term Services and Supports but Were Afraid to Ask, will give insight into the challenges and opportunities that Managed Long Term Services and Supports provide to HCBS Providers. Ms. Coleman is a former Texas state Medicaid official with an expertise in Medicaid integrated managed care including the implementation of programs for complex populations with needs for home and community based services. Pam is a frequent presenter at national conferences on complex care populations and integrated delivery systems. Marc Gold, a senior consultant from Sellers Dorsey, will also be attending this year’s conference. Mr. Gold has nearly three decades of experience in directing long term services and supports policy. Most recently, Marc was an executive with the Texas Department of Aging and Disability Services as the special advisor on policy and leading Texas’s Olmstead efforts.
Sellers Dorsey is a national consulting firm with a reputation for developing successful solutions in Medicaid managed care funding, management and program innovation. The expert consultants at Sellers Dorsey’s provide a combination of high-level consulting services, business development and planning, technical assistance and advisory services, procurement assistance, implementation assistance, post-implementation assistance and operational planning.
For more information about Sellers Dorsey consulting services, please visit http://www.sellersdorsey.com . To meet with a member of the Sellers Dorsey team during the conference, please email info(at)sellersdorsey(dot)com.
About Sellers Dorsey
Sellers Dorsey consists of an industry-leading team of consultants and thought leaders from the worlds of policy, government, business, and industry, allowing the firm to provide a fully integrated suite of services to clients. Sellers Dorsey has a deep understanding of Medicaid, having consulted in over 30 states on a range of financing, policy and operational projects, and Medicare financing and policy. Its reputation is one of creativity and accomplishment. More at http://www.sellersdorsey.com .
